I'm trying to learn to use Cantera.  I believe that it will be a very 
powe=
rful tool, but I think I'm having trouble using it to it's full 
capabiliti=
es.  I've learned quite a bit by looking at the Demos and 
Tutorials that c=
ame with the windows distribution of cantera (with 
Python).  I've figured =
out how to use the reactor module to simulate a 
transient CSTR.  At the mo=
ment I'm only interested in the steady state 
solution to a problem.  It's =
a fairly simple matter to allow the 
transient CSTR problem to go to a stea=
dy state, but this seems like a 
waste of computation time.  Is there a way=
 to model a steady state CSTR 
directly in Cantera?

Paul
